intro: Leptorkis duthiei, commonly known as the Duthie's spurge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its production of a milky latex sap. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lanceolate, waxy leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the spurge family. Leptorkis duthiei is adapted to survive in harsh environments, with deep roots and a capacity to store water in its leaves.
